data.title: Michael Cera: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Michael Cera: Check out the list of all Michael Cera movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Michael Cera news on Times of India.
data.text:
Sausage Party: Foodtopia release date, cast, where to watch - REVEALED

etimes.in / Jul 13, 2024, 15:00 (IST)

​The comedy animated series Sausage Party: Foodtopia is set to premiere this month. Known for its dark, adult humor, the show features the voices of Seth Rogen, Michael Cera, and Kristen Wiig. The series will have eight episodes, and anticipation is high following the release of its trailer

From Jenna Ortega to Lily Gladstone films, check out lineup for Tribeca Festival 2024

ANI / Apr 19, 2024, 14:28 (IST)

The 2024 Tribeca Festival unveils an eclectic lineup of 103 feature films by 114 directors from 48 nations, including world premieres of documentaries about Diane von Furstenberg, Liza Minnelli, Harry Belafonte, and more, promising a diverse cinematic experience. The festival, marking its 23rd edition, is poised to captivate audiences from June 5-16 in New York City, showcasing thought-provoking discussions, boundary-breaking narratives, and galvanizing stories that reflect the essence of the present moment. With over 13,000 applications, this year's lineup boasts 86 world debuts, emphasizing inclusivity and diversity, with half of the films directed by women and a significant representation of people of color, indigenous, and Black filmmakers. Tribeca Festival co-founder Jane Rosenthal expresses excitement about engaging with audiences on timely subjects, while festival director Cara Cusumano highlights the remarkable power of storytelling to illuminate our world amidst global challenges.

America Ferrera credits Latina identity for securing role in Barbie movie

etimes.in / Jan 01, 2024, 13:59 (IST)

Ferrera emphasized that while the role was written as Latina, being Latina was not the character's sole purpose. Gloria was portrayed as a full-fledged human, representing various aspects beyond her ethnicity, challenging traditional "check the box" casting practices. Ferrera appreciates that this marked a positive shift in the industry for her. Earlier, Ferrera had shared with ComicBook.com that she was pleased to play Gloria in Barbie, as it was the part she would have chosen

Bryan Lee O'Malley's 'Scott Pilgrim' graphic novel series to not have a second season; it will remain 'self-contained for now': Report

etimes.in / Nov 28, 2023, 02:04 (IST)

'Scott Pilgrim Takes Off,' the anime series based on Bryan Lee O'Malley's graphic novel series, premiered on Netflix on November 17. O'Malley and executive producer BenDavid Grabinski explained in an interview with Rolling Stone that the show is designed to be ‘self-contained for now’ to avoid cancellation after one season. The series features the original cast from the 2010 live-action film adaptation, including Michael Cera and Mary Elizabeth Winstead. Science SARU, a Japanese animation studio, animated the series. Edgar Wright, the director of the live-action film, serves as an executive producer.

Greta Gerwig apprehensive of directing 'Narnia'

ANI / Jul 22, 2023, 10:49 (IST)

Greta Gerwig admits she is afraid of directing her upcoming project - two 'Narnia' movies. Gerwig revealed that she is "properly scared" of her upcoming project based on C.S. Lewis' best-selling novel series from the 1950s, 'The Chronicles of Narnia.'

Legend of Hank: Paws of Fury – if you watch it with your kids, you may love it, say netizens

etimes.in / Feb 03, 2023, 21:23 (IST)

This weekend, you and your kids could decide to watch the six-month old Nickelodeon offering, Legend of Hank: Paws of Fury, an animated film now streaming on Amazon Prime. It’s the story of Hank, a lovable dog who is besotted with dreams about becoming a mighty samurai. And so it is that he sets off in search of what destiny has in store for him. He ends up being hired as a samurai to save a village of cats.

Brie Larson’s version of ‘Black Sheep’ song from ‘Scott Pilgrim’ goes viral

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Jun 05, 2021, 13:56 (IST)

Fans of Brie Larson have gone into a frenzy with the announcement that director Edgar Wright’s 'Scott Pilgrim vs. the World’s’ new extended soundtrack will make a digital debut on July 9. The most exciting part of the announcement is the fact that there’s going to be a new version of the cult song from the movie ‘Black Sheep’ with Brie Larson.

Sausage Party: Foodtopia' trailer unveils wild new adventures

etimes.in / Jun 12, 2024, 12:41 (IST)

​The trailer promises to keep the franchise's signature risqué humor and unconventional characters. Fans can expect to see familiar elements such as wild parties, unique character interactions, and adult-themed humor. The preview offers a glimpse of the chaos that ensues as the food characters navigate their new reality. "Sausage Party: Foodtopia" picks up where the movie left off, with the characters celebrating their victory over the supermarket. However, their newfound freedom is short-lived as they struggle to survive outside the store.

Critics Choice Awards 2024: Margot Robbie's 'Barbie' wins Best Comedy, Best Original Screenplay

ANI / Jan 15, 2024, 13:45 (IST)

At the Critics Choice Awards 2024, Margot Robbie's fantasy comedy film 'Barbie' clinched the titles of Best Comedy and Best Original Screenplay. The movie, directed by Greta Gerwig, also secured awards for Best Costume Design and Best Production Design. With a record-breaking 18 nominations, 'Barbie' surpassed achievements of films like 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' and 'The Shape of Water.' Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer' and Yorgos Lanthimos' 'Poor Things' received 13 nominations each. Despite mixed reviews, 'Barbie' emerged as one of the highest-grossing films of 2023, facing a box office clash with Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer.' A historic feat was achieved as 'Barbie' and director Greta Gerwig surpassed $1 billion in global box office gross, marking the first instance of a movie directed solely by a woman reaching this milestone. The film features Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling in lead roles and explores a quest for self-discovery in the real world beyond Barbieland.
